byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Former Congolese politician Jean-Pierre Bemba is convicted of coaching and bribing witnesses to give false testimony by International Criminal Court; Bemba is already serving 18-year prison sentence for war crimes and crimes against humanity; witness tampering conviction sets legal precedent for court.

headline.print_headline: Congolese Politician Is Found Guilty of Tampering
headline.main: Jean-Pierre Bemba, Congolese Politician Imprisoned for War Crimes, Is Convicted of Witness Tampering

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Mr. Bemba and four others were found guilty by the International Criminal Court in The Hague....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bemba and four others were found guilty by the International Criminal Court in The Hague.
